e7593f442a5140d008ee6f1994453047 (01:18): dimes - positioning: static-is default, relative - element preserves it's space and you can move it, absolute - element desn't preserve space so other elements can go behind and so on, fixed is the same but is absolute to the screen so when you scroll it stays at the same place - but this one doesn't work in some IE's. That's why I said you should you only relative and absolute
e7593f442a5140d008ee6f1994453047 (01:18): but when mefisto is that good as he thinks he can give you better advice, coz according to him i am retarded

cc154864006ba2ebcd35f46d936c820f (01:28): Riyonuk, you shouls be using mostyly classes
cc154864006ba2ebcd35f46d936c820f (01:29): main reason is , you can add multiple classes to each element
e3656c8cf0bb5e01bcdde19182fc7e6c (01:29): sorry, had a call
e3656c8cf0bb5e01bcdde19182fc7e6c (01:30): you did the above, except with # ?
cc154864006ba2ebcd35f46d936c820f (01:30): so you end up with smaller css file and better page semantics
e3656c8cf0bb5e01bcdde19182fc7e6c (01:30): like I say, I don't use id's for style, but it *should* be a#my-funky-id:hover
e3656c8cf0bb5e01bcdde19182fc7e6c (01:31): id's are for one-off things, and identifying sections, handy for jumping in a page and stuff, but for styles, classes all the way
f0c0a7ec6b631d3c83f935679fecb993 (01:32): [or it depends on what i am doing ;)
e3656c8cf0bb5e01bcdde19182fc7e6c (01:32): everyone works differently, and that's a good thing. I just find it easier and more efficient
cc154864006ba2ebcd35f46d936c820f (01:32): Riyonuk, you said that you rarely use classes
3d2d800163bd186050b12164fd979515 (01:33): Yeah, always using ID's
3d2d800163bd186050b12164fd979515 (01:33): banner, navigation, left column, right column, footer, done :/
3d2d800163bd186050b12164fd979515 (01:34): and I don't use classes because I just style the normal way, like all paragraphs or all headings
